intro: Convolvulus steppicola, commonly known as the steppe convolvulus, is a flowering plant native to the steppes of Central Asia. It is a low-growing annual or biennial herb with hairy stems and heart-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, funnel-shaped flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in dry, well-drained soils and is often found in open grasslands and disturbed areas. Convolvulus steppicola is adapted to arid environments and plays a role in stabilizing soil in its native habitat.
